meanings.definition: Not willing to talk or give information.
meanings.sent1: The shy student was incommunicative during the class presentation.
meanings.sent2: The incommunicative coworker rarely joins in on office conversations.
meanings.sent3: The incommunicative cat refused to meow when asked about its day.
meanings.sent4: The old house stood incommunicative, its walls holding secrets of the past.
meanings.sent5: The fog enveloped the town, creating an incommunicative barrier between neighbors.

meanings.sent1: The broken phone made the call incommunicative and full of static.
meanings.sent2: The incommunicative toddler struggled to express his needs to his parents.
meanings.sent3: The incommunicative robot kept repeating the same error message.
meanings.sent4: The dense forest was incommunicative, blocking all signals from the outside world.
meanings.sent5: The heavy snowfall rendered the landscape incommunicative, muffling all sounds.
